headline: Coca-Cola Exits Frozen Juice Concentrates As Portfolio Story Evolves
summary: Coca-Cola is discontinuing Minute Maid frozen juice concentrates in the U.S. and Canada. The move reflects changing consumer preferences away from frozen juice products. The change affects a long standing category in Coca-Cola's North American portfolio. Coca-Cola, listed as NYSE:KO, is making this product shift while its shares trade at $77.35. The stock has logged returns of 5.9% over the past week, 13.9% over the past month, and 11.9% year to date, with a 1 year return of 26.2%. Over 3...
